intro: Coussarea terepaimensis, commonly known as the Philippine holly. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small seeds.
